#!/usr/bin/env bash

WALLPAPER_DIR="/media/winD/Wallpaper/"
MONITOR="eDP-1"
WALL_LIST="$HOME/.cache/wallpapers.list"
LAST_USED="$HOME/.cache/last_wallpaper.txt"

# Generate wallpaper list if it doesn't exist
if [ ! -f "$WALL_LIST" ]; then
    find "$WALLPAPER_DIR" -type f -iregex ".*\.\(jpg\|jpeg\|png\)" | sort > "$WALL_LIST"
fi

# Read wallpapers into an array
mapfile -t WALLPAPERS < "$WALL_LIST"

# Find index of last used wallpaper
LAST_INDEX=0
if [ -f "$LAST_USED" ]; then
    LAST_WALL=$(cat "$LAST_USED")
    for i in "${!WALLPAPERS[@]}"; do
        [[ "${WALLPAPERS[$i]}" == "$LAST_WALL" ]] && LAST_INDEX=$i && break
    done
fi

# Calculate next wallpaper index (wrap around)
NEXT_INDEX=$(( (LAST_INDEX + 1) % ${#WALLPAPERS[@]} ))
WALLPAPER="${WALLPAPERS[$NEXT_INDEX]}"

# Store the selected wallpaper
echo "$WALLPAPER" > "$LAST_USED"

# Validate the file
if ! identify "$WALLPAPER" &>/dev/null; then
    echo "Invalid image: $WALLPAPER"
    exit 1
fi

# Generate pywal colors
wal -i "$WALLPAPER"

# Restart hyprpaper cleanly
killall -q hyprpaper
sleep 0.7
hyprpaper &

# Wait until IPC is available (max 3s)
for i in {1..30}; do
    if hyprctl hyprpaper preload "$WALLPAPER" &>/dev/null; then
        break
    fi
    sleep 0.1
done

# Apply wallpaper via IPC
hyprctl hyprpaper preload "$WALLPAPER"
hyprctl hyprpaper wallpaper "$MONITOR,$WALLPAPER"

# Relaunch themed overlays (optional)
~/.config/hypr/scripts/cava.sh &
~/.config/hypr/scripts/clock.sh &

#!/usr/bin/env bash

WALLPAPER_DIR="/media/winD/Wallpaper/"
MONITOR="eDP-1"  # update if needed: run `hyprctl monitors`

# Get current wallpaper to avoid repeating
CURRENT_WALL=$(hyprctl hyprpaper listloaded | awk 'NR==2 {print $3}')
WALLPAPER=$(find "$WALLPAPER_DIR" -type f -iregex ".*\.\(jpg\|jpeg\|png\)" ! -name "$(basename "$CURRENT_WALL")" | shuf -n 1)

# Pre-check the file is valid
if ! identify "$WALLPAPER" &>/dev/null; then
    echo "Invalid image: $WALLPAPER"
    exit 1
fi

# Generate pywal colors from the new wallpaper
wal -i "$WALLPAPER"

# Kill and restart hyprpaper to avoid IPC flakiness
killall -q hyprpaper
sleep 0.7
hyprpaper &

# Wait for the socket to be ready (max 3s)
for i in {1..30}; do
    if hyprctl hyprpaper preload "$WALLPAPER" &>/dev/null; then
        break
    fi
    sleep 0.1
done

# Apply the wallpaper
hyprctl hyprpaper preload "$WALLPAPER"
hyprctl hyprpaper wallpaper "$MONITOR,$WALLPAPER"

# (Optional) Reload other themed apps
~/.config/hypr/scripts/cava.sh &
~/.config/hypr/scripts/clock.sh &

#!/bin/bash

# Extract COLOR1 from pywal
COLOR1=$(sed -n '2p' "$HOME/.cache/wal/colors")

# Validate it's a hex color (7 chars including #)
if [[ ! "$COLOR1" =~ ^#[0-9a-fA-F]{6}$ ]]; then
    COLOR1="#ff69b4"  # fallback to pink
fi

# Update cava config with proper quoted color
sed -i "s/^foreground = .*/foreground = '$COLOR1'/" "$HOME/.config/cava/config"

# Launch cava with pywal-themed kitty
kitty --class kitty --title cava \
      --config "$HOME/.cache/wal/colors-kitty.conf" \
      -o "font_size=6" \
      -e cava &

#!/bin/bash

# Get COLOR1 from pywal palette
COLOR1=$(sed -n '2p' "$HOME/.cache/wal/colors")

# Patch cava config to use COLOR1 as foreground
sed -i "s/^foreground = .*/foreground = $COLOR1/" "$HOME/.config/cava/config"

# Launch cava in kitty with pywal colors
kitty --class kitty --title cava \
      --config "$HOME/.cache/wal/colors-kitty.conf" \
      -o "font_size=6" \
      -e cava &

#!/bin/bash

# Get second color from pywal palette (COLOR1)
BAR_COLOR=$(sed -n '2p' "$HOME/.cache/wal/colors")

# Launch kitty with pywal colors and cava using the bar color
kitty --class kitty --title cava \
      --config "$HOME/.cache/wal/colors-kitty.conf" \
      -o "font_size=6" \
      env color="$BAR_COLOR" cava &

#!/bin/bash

# Source pywal's tty color script (sets ANSI colors in terminal)
source "$HOME/.cache/wal/colors-tty.sh"

# Launch tty-clock in a kitty window using pywal colors
kitty --class kitty --title tty-clock \
      --config "$HOME/.cache/wal/colors-kitty.conf" \
      -o "font_size=5" \
      -e tty-clock -s -c -C 5 -n &

#!/bin/bash

KITTY_CONFIG="$HOME/.cache/wal/colors-kitty.conf"

# Toggle cava window
if pgrep -f "kitty.*title cava" > /dev/null; then
    pkill -f "kitty.*title cava"
else
    kitty --class kitty --title cava --config "$KITTY_CONFIG" -o "font_size=6" -e cava &
fi

#!/bin/bash

if pgrep -f "kitty.*title cava" > /dev/null; then
    pkill -f "kitty.*title cava"
else
    kitty --class kitty --title cava --config NONE -o "font_size 6" -e cava &
fi

windowrule = float, title:(tty-clock)
windowrule = size 240 100, title:(tty-clock)
windowrule = move 1175 200, title:(tty-clock)
windowrule = noborder, title:(tty-clock)

#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Desired position and size
X=1100
Y=400
WIDTH=300
HEIGHT=265

# Temporary rule tag
RULE_TAG="cava_overlay"

# Add temporary rules for cava window
hyprctl --batch "\
  addwindowrulev2 float, class:^(kitty)$, title:^(cava)$, tag:$RULE_TAG; \
  addwindowrulev2 size ${WIDTH} ${HEIGHT}, class:^(kitty)$, title:^(cava)$, tag:$RULE_TAG; \
  addwindowrulev2 move ${X} ${Y}, class:^(kitty)$, title:^(cava)$, tag:$RULE_TAG; \
  addwindowrulev2 animation slide, class:^(kitty)$, title:^(cava)$, tag:$RULE_TAG; \
  addwindowrulev2 opacity 0.9 0.9, class:^(kitty)$, title:^(cava)$, tag:$RULE_TAG; \
"

# Launch kitty running cava
kitty --class kitty --title cava -e cava &

#!/usr/bin/env bash

WALLPAPER_DIR="/media/winD/Wallpaper/"
CURRENT_WALL=$(hyprctl hyprpaper listloaded | grep -oP '(?<=: ).*')

# Pick a new random wallpaper that is not the current one
WALLPAPER=$(find "$WALLPAPER_DIR" -type f ! -name "$(basename "$CURRENT_WALL")" | shuf -n 1)

# If no wallpaper found, fallback
[ -z "$WALLPAPER" ] && WALLPAPER="$CURRENT_WALL"

# Try IPC command
if hyprctl hyprpaper preload "$WALLPAPER" && hyprctl hyprpaper wallpaper " ,$WALLPAPER"; then
    echo "Wallpaper changed via hyprpaper IPC: $WALLPAPER"
else
    echo "IPC failed. Falling back to config file..."

    # Write config manually
    CONFIG="$HOME/.config/hypr/hyprpaper.conf"
    echo -e "ipc = true\npreload = $WALLPAPER\nwallpaper = ,$WALLPAPER" > "$CONFIG"

    # Restart hyprpaper
    pkill hyprpaper
    hyprpaper &
fi

# Optional: regenerate pywal theme
wal -i "$WALLPAPER"

#!/usr/bin/env bash

WALLPAPER_DIR="/media/winD/Wallpaper/"
CURRENT_WALL=$(hyprctl hyprpaper listloaded)

# Get a random wallpaper that is not the current one
WALLPAPER=$(find "$WALLPAPER_DIR" -type f ! -name "$(basename "$CURRENT_WALL")" | shuf -n 1)

# Apply the selected wallpaper
hyprctl hyprpaper reload ,"$WALLPAPER"

#!/usr/bin/env bash

WALLPAPER_DIR="$HOME/wallpapers/"
CURRENT_WALL=$(hyprctl hyprpaper listloaded)

# Get a random wallpaper that is not the current one
WALLPAPER=$(find "$WALLPAPER_DIR" -type f ! -name "$(basename "$CURRENT_WALL")" | shuf -n 1)

# Apply the selected wallpaper
hyprctl hyprpaper reload ,"$WALLPAPER"

#!/usr/bin/env bash

WALLPAPER_DIR="$HOME/wallpapers/"
CURRENT_WALL=$(hyprctl hyprpaper listloaded)
# Get the name of the focused monitor with hyprctl
FOCUSED_MONITOR=$(hyprctl monitors -j | jq -r '.[] | select(.focused) | .name')
# Get a random wallpaper that is not the current one
WALLPAPER=$(find "$WALLPAPER_DIR" -type f ! -name "$(basename "$CURRENT_WALL")" | shuf -n 1)

# Apply the selected wallpaper
hyprctl hyprpaper reload "$FOCUSED_MONITOR","$WALLPAPER"
